SharedMem:
["Mark and his friend Kyle are flatmates", 
"Mark and his friend Kyle just returned home after a month-long trip to Europe.", 
"During their absence, they asked a friend to water the plants in their apartment and to open the windows once a week for air."]
ScenarioPremise: Kyle asks: "Can you open the window?"
Options:
["To open the window.",
"To say that the window can't be opened",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say if the window can be opened"]
LcGoal: Kyle wants to check the plants
LcContext: As soon as they enter, they notice that there is a bad smell in the living room
LcSpecificMem: Kyle notice that the window handle is broken
IlcGoal: Mark wants to open the window

IlcSpecificMem: Mark doesn't know that the window handle is broken

SharedMem:
["Jane is helping her friend Katy to move into her new studio apartment.",
"The studio apartment is located on the second floor and the building does not have a lift.",
"Katy has many heavy and bulky boxes to transport."]
ScenarioPremise: Jane asks: "Can you shut the front door?”
Options:
["To shut the front door.",
"To say if the door can be shutted",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say that the door can't be shutted"]
LcGoal: Jane needs to go to the bathroom
LcContext: They just finished carrying all the boxes to the new apartment, but they are exhausted, so they pile them up in the hallway.
LcSpecificMem: Jane sees that the boxes are blocking the open front door.
IlcGoal: Katy wants to empty the boxes to tidy up
IlcContext: They just finished carrying all the boxes to the new apartment, but they are exhausted, so they pile them up in the hallway.
IlcSpecificMem: Katy doesn't notice that the boxes are blocking the open front door

SharedMem:
["Kyle has just finished work and must meet his friend David in the main square of the city.", 
"Their goal for the evening is to go drinking in some pub, to shelter from the cold and rain.",
"Kyle is reaching David, who has already arrived in the square and is waiting for him.",
"They haven't decided which pub to go to yet."]
ScenarioPremise: As soon as David sees Kyle says: "How about the pub across the street?”
Options:
["To decide if he wants to go to the pub across the street",  
 "﻿To inform his friend that the pub is closed",
"To wait for an answer",
"To give an opinion about the pub across the street"]
LcGoal: David wants to wait Kyle and go drinking in some pub
LcContext: David is waiting for Kyle in the square
LcSpecificMem: David knows that the pub across the street is closed
IlcGoal: Kyle wants to know which places are open
IlcContext: Kyle haven't check yet which places are open
IlcSpecificMem: He doesn't know that the only open pub is on the other side of the city
IlcExtras: Kyle finally arrives in the square
Illocutor_answer: To decide if he wants to go to the pub across the street

SharedMem:
["Ellie and Ryan are a married couple.",
"Every morning Ryan picks up the mail and brings it home, then both Ellie and him read the letters received.",
"It's usually Ryan who reads aloud, so that Ellie can listen and do other tasks in the meantime."]
ScenarioPremise: Ellie says: "can you read this letter?".

["To read the mail.",
"To say if he's able to read",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say that he is not able to read without glasses"]
LcSpecificMem: Ellie knows that Ryan hasn't found his glasses since yesterday afternoon.
IlcGoal: Ryan wants to read the mails.

IlcSpecificMem: Ryan doesn't realize he lost his glasses
IlcExtras: Ryan comes back in the house with the mails.
